trans-unit.source: Provides data for the **Navigating** event.

These event arguments contain information about the navigation that was requested, and are passed to handlers of the **Navigating** event, which is implemented by the following: - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigating?displayProperty=fullName> - <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigating?displayProperty=fullName> - <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.Navigating?displayProperty=fullName> - <xref:System.Windows.Application.Navigating?displayProperty=fullName> NavigatingCancelEventArgs encapsulates the following details of the navigation request: - **Navigation Initiation**: <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.NavigationMode%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Navigator%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.IsNavigationInitiator%2A>.
- **Navigation Content**: <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Uri%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Content%2A>.
- **Navigation Request**: <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationFailedEventArgs.WebRequest%2A>.

- **Navigation State**: <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.ExtraData%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.ContentStateToSave%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.TargetContentState%2A>.
This information allows you to both evaluate the nature of the navigation request, and view and update specified request details before navigation occurs.

Based on the navigation request information provided by NavigatingCancelEventArgs, or based on application-specific state or code, you can completely prevent navigation by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` (by default, <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> is `false`).
Gets a reference to the content object that is being navigated to.
You can navigate to content using either a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] or an object.

When navigating to an object, which occurs when calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, Content contains a reference to the content object that is being navigated to.
Additionally, the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Uri%2A> property will be `null`.
A <xref:System.Object> reference to the content object that is being navigated to; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets and sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is associated with the back navigation history entry for the page being navigated from.
<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigating> event is raised when navigating from one piece of content to another.
The content that is being navigated from is added to back navigation history.
You can set ContentStateToSave with a custom <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState> object to associate state information with content in navigation history.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is associated with the back navigation history entry for the page being navigated from.
Gets the optional data <xref:System.Object> that was passed when navigation started.
ExtraData can be used to pass context-specific data that is specific to a particular navigation.

ExtraData contains a reference to the object that is passed as the second argument when calling either <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Otherwise, it is `null`.
The optional data <xref:System.Object> that was passed when navigation started.

Indicates whether the navigator (<xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Frame"></xref>) that is specified by <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Navigator*> is servicing this navigation, or whether a parent navigator is doing so.

A <xref:System.Boolean> value that is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the navigator that is specified by <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Navigator*> is servicing this navigation.
Otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> is returned, such as during a nested <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Frame"></xref> navigation.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode"></xref> value that indicates the type of navigation that is occurring.
The types of navigation that can occur are: - Navigating to new content (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode>).
- Navigating to the previous item in back navigation history (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode>).
- Navigating to the next item in forward navigation history (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode>).
- Refreshing existing content (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode>).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationMode"></xref> value that indicates the type of navigation that is occurring.
The navigator that raised this event.
While Navigator stores a reference to the navigator that raised this event, the navigator may not have actually initiated the navigation.
To determine whether this navigator did initiate the current navigation, inspect the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.IsNavigationInitiator%2A> property.
An <xref:System.Object> that is the navigator that raised this event
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is to be applied to the content being navigated to.

TargetContentState will contain a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState> object if navigating to content in back or forward navigation history that has a <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState> object associated with it.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is to be applied to the content being navigated to.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for the content being navigated to.
You can navigate to content using either an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] or an object.

When navigating to an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)], which occurs when calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, Uri contains the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the content being navigated to.
Additionally, the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Content%2A> property will be `null`.
The <xref:System.Uri> for the content being navigated to.
If navigating to an object, Uri is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> object that is used to request the specified content.
<xref:System.Net.WebRequest?displayProperty=fullName> is an abstract base class that encapsulates a Web request, and is protocol agnostic.

For each common protocol, the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlewinfx](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-titlewinfx-md.md)] includes a class that derives from <xref:System.Net.WebRequest?displayProperty=fullName> and extends it with protocol specific state and behavior, including: - <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackWebRequest>: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)] that use the `pack://` scheme to request application data files (see [WPF Application Resource, Content, and Data Files](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)).
- <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest>: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)] that use the `http://` scheme to request files from Web servers.
- <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest>: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)] that use the `ftp://` scheme to request files from FTP servers.
- <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest>: [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-urisharpplural-md.md)] that use the `file://` scheme to request local files.
You can both view and modify <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> details.
WebRequest is `null` when navigation occurs by: - Using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser> control.
- Calling <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A> - Setting <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Content%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
- Navigating through HTML content in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>.
Gets the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest?displayProperty=fullName> object that is used to request the specified content.
